snippet: Defense Secretary Ashton Carter opposed the plan for U.S. and Russian military collaboration against ISIS, which Secretary of State John Kerry supports....
abstract: Agreement with Russia announced by Sec of State John Kerry to reduce violence in Syria is opposed by Defense Sec Ashton B Carter, widening divide between men; Pentagon officials have split over whether they will fulfill their end of bargain by sharing important information about Islamic State with Russia if cease-fire holds for seven days.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and DAVID E. SANGER
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Eric Schmitt and Julie Hirschfeld Davis from Washington; Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon; Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva; and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Defense Secretary Ashton Carter opposed the plan for U.S. and Russian military collaboration against ISIS, which Secretary of State John Kerry supports.

headline.main: Details of Syria Pact Widen Rift Between John Kerry and Pentagon

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
